update.description:
Create a directory `/srv/ccache` on the host and use it when running docker to shared compilation artifacts among the different builds.

The implementation includes a display of the statistics (ccache -s) before and after the compilation.

For the testing I've used sdformat:

  * First run was done with empty ccache dir
  * The green line is the one that measures compilation time
  * The variations of the red line are interesting but out of the scope of this PR
  * Note that the gain is permanent since the code base did not change from 1-6
  * Run 7 and 8 were done changing the source branch

The [resulting plot and the rest of the test information](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64_test_ccache_plot_3/plot/).
update.title: Support for CCACHE option on Linux (with docker)

pull_request.title: Support for CCACHE option on Linux (with docker)

pullrequest.title: Support for CCACHE option on Linux (with docker)

content.raw:
I had some problems setting the cache for ccache inside docker, I finally used the `ccache -M command`.

The [results](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-no-gpu_ccache/plot/) are very promising the compilation time is reduced from around 3500s to 500s when compiling the same set of sources.
content.html:
I had some problems setting the cache for ccache inside docker, I finally used the ccache -M command.

The results are very promising the compilation time is reduced from around 3500s to 500s when compiling the same set of sources.

content.raw: I did not merge this PR because I'm not able to see improvements in the [gazebo build (3 and 4 runs)](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-no-gpu_ccache/plot/). I would sat that 1Gb of ccache is too low to see impact in the gazebo build but I still need to confirm it.
content.html: I did not merge this PR because I'm not able to see improvements in the gazebo build (3 and 4 runs). I would sat that 1Gb of ccache is too low to see impact in the gazebo build but I still need to confirm it.

content.raw:
I agree, I think I just didn't read all the logic in docker_generate_dockerfile.bash

I still think it needs quoting:

~~~
[ -z "${ENABLE_CCACHE}"]
~~~
content.html:
I agree, I think I just didn't read all the logic in docker_generate_dockerfile.bash

I still think it needs quoting:

[ -z "${ENABLE_CCACHE}"]

content.raw: I always try not to use negative logic for naming variables, not sure if this applies to DISABLE_ but I normally can read easily and faster positive logic and do less errors when coding.

content.raw:
should we call this variable `DISABLE_CCACHE`? ccache seems to be enabled by default and will be disabled if this variable contains anything

also, should it be quoted?
content.html:
should we call this variable DISABLE_CCACHE? ccache seems to be enabled by default and will be disabled if this variable contains anything

also, should it be quoted?
